Articles.Content: I really should make my own mun mission tutorial video.

I\'m going to make a video of my attempts to find and catalogue every Mun mission video tutorial that exists. There must be getting on for six or seven hundred thousand by now, and I reckon that if I keep track of certain statistics in each, find the average for all of those, I\'d have the perfect mission plan.

And using that information, I\'ll be able to start work on my own video lesson!

I\'m going to make a video of my attempts to find and catalogue every Mun mission video tutorial that exists. There must be getting on for six or seven hundred thousand by now, and I reckon that if I keep track of certain statistics in each, find the average for all of those, I\'d have the perfect mission plan.

And using that information, I\'ll be able to start work on my own video lesson!

I personally wouldn\'t take the average of all those videos. There are too many that teach you to do something the 'wrong' way. I put 'wrong' in parenthesis because you can still accomplish the goal using those methods, it\'s just very inefficient to do so.
Nice frame rate. And that rocket sure is purdy. Most tutorials use stock parts, since new players probably don\'t want to mess with mods. So it\'s nice to see some eye candy on this one.
Unfortunately, this video is not available in Germany because GEMA is a huge giant f > tard
How did you get to the orbit screen thingo
